title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 33 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 33 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
lineList.cn: 约伯阿，请听我的话，留心听我一切的言语。

lineList.en: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
lineList.cn: 我现在开口，用舌发言。

lineList.en: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
lineList.cn: 我的言语要发明心中所存的正直。我所知道的，我嘴唇要诚实地说出。

lineList.en: The spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
lineList.cn: 神的灵造我，全能者的气使我得生。

lineList.en: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
lineList.cn: 你若回答我，就站起来，在我面前陈明。

lineList.en: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.
lineList.cn: 我在神面前与你一样，也是用土造成。

lineList.en: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
lineList.cn: 我不用威严惊吓你，也不用势力重压你。

lineList.en: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
lineList.cn: 你所说的，我听见了，也听见你的言语，说，

lineList.en: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
lineList.cn: 我是清洁无过的，我是无辜的。在我里面也没有罪孽。

lineList.en: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
lineList.cn: 神找机会攻击我，以我为仇敌，

lineList.en: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
lineList.cn: 把我的脚上了木狗，窥察我一切的道路。

lineList.en: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
lineList.cn: 我要回答你说，你这话无理，因神比世人更大。

lineList.en: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
lineList.cn: 你为何与他争论呢。因他的事都不对人解说。

lineList.en: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
lineList.cn: 神说一次，两次，世人却不理会。

lineList.en: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
lineList.cn: 人躺在床上沉睡的时候，神就用梦，和夜间的异象，

lineList.en: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
lineList.cn: 开通他们的耳朵，将当受的教训印在他们心上，

lineList.en: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
lineList.cn: 好叫人不从自己的谋算，不行骄傲的事。（原文作将骄傲向人隐藏）

lineList.en: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
lineList.cn: 拦阻人不陷于坑里，不死在刀下。

lineList.en: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:
lineList.cn: 人在床上被惩治，骨头中不住地疼痛。

lineList.en: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.
lineList.cn: 以致他的口厌弃食物，心厌恶美味。

lineList.en: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
lineList.cn: 他的肉消瘦，不得再见。先前不见的骨头都凸出来。

lineList.en: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
lineList.cn: 他的灵魂临近深坑。他的生命近于灭命的。

lineList.en: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:
lineList.cn: 一千天使中，若有一个作传话的与神同在，指示人所当行的事。

lineList.en: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
lineList.cn: 神就给他开恩，说，救赎他免得下坑。我已经得了赎价。

lineList.en: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:
lineList.cn: 他的肉要比孩童的肉更嫩。他就返老还童。

lineList.en: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
lineList.cn: 他祷告神，神就喜悦他，使他欢呼朝见神的面。神又看他为义。

lineList.en: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;
lineList.cn: 他在人前歌唱说，我犯了罪，颠倒是非，这竟与我无益。

lineList.en: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
lineList.cn: 神救赎我的灵魂免入深坑。我的生命也必见光。

lineList.en: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,
lineList.cn: 神两次，三次，向人行这一切的事。

lineList.en: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
lineList.cn: 为要从深坑救回人的灵魂，使他被光照耀与活人一样。

lineList.en: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
lineList.cn: 约伯阿，你当侧耳听我的话，不要作声，等我讲说。

lineList.en: If thou hast anything to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
lineList.cn: 你若有话说，就可以回答我。你只管说，因我愿以你为是。

lineList.en: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
lineList.cn: 若不然，你就听我说。你不要作声，我便将智慧教训你。
